thread.title: U.S.-Stock Funds Start the Year With 4.4% January Gain

author: William Power
title: U.S.-Stock Funds Start the Year With 4.4% January Gain
text:
A global stock rally to start 2018 has been pumping up most stock-fund investors and their 401(k)s. Yet many analysts caution that a pullback must surely be on the horizon.
The average diversified U.S.-stock fund registered a total return of 4.4% for January, according to Thomson Reuters Lipper data. International-stock funds were up 5.2%. The trend—good gains for U.S. funds, and even better for overseas—continues the pattern of 2017, when U.S.-stock funds rose 18.3% and international 26.8%.
